narrative: Every morning, amazing chalk art shows up around school.
Someone draws beautiful animals and flowers that make everyone stop and stare.
But nobody knows who the mystery artist is!

choice_points.question: Rishi really wants to figure out this puzzle. What should they do?

options.text: Hide and watch quietly to see who comes early
Ask friends if they noticed anyone with chalk on their hands

consequences.text: Hiding behind the big oak tree early one morning, Rishi sees Jordan creating the incredible art before anyone gets to school.
Friends mention seeing someone with chalk-covered fingers... and Rishi notices Jordan's hands look pretty dusty.

continuation: When Rishi talks to Jordan, Jordan looks totally scared about being found out.
Jordan explains, "I love making art, but... I don't want people judging my work."
Rishi promises to keep the secret and asks, "How can I help you feel better about sharing your talent?"

reflections.question: Have you ever had a skill or hobby you were nervous to share? What made you feel that way?
What's one way you could support a friend who's hiding their talents?

narrative: Amazing chalk art shows up all around school every morning, like clockwork.

Even though students and teachers love the artwork, nobody knows who's behind it.

choice_points.question: Rishi comes up with a solid plan to figure out who this talented person is. What approach should they take?

options.text: Set up some strategic early-morning watching to catch the artist at work
Analyze the art techniques and style to identify the creator's signature moves

consequences.text: Through careful early-morning watching, Rishi discovers Jordan's extraordinary skills... and realizes they choose these quiet hours when creating feels safer.
Detailed analysis of the advanced shading methods, perspective work, and composition helps Rishi recognize Jordan's distinctive style from classroom observations.

continuation: When Rishi respectfully confronts Jordan, they admit to creating the art... while expressing major anxiety about public recognition and potential judgment.
Jordan reveals, "I chose to stay anonymous because... well, past experiences with sharing creative work led to unwanted attention and critical comments."
Rishi recognizes that Jordan's exceptional talent needs supportive strategies that honor their need for emotional safety.
Together, they explore approaches that could help Jordan gain confidence while maintaining control over how much attention they receive.

reflections.question: Think about times when your abilities felt vulnerable to others' opinions... what helped you feel secure enough to share your authentic talents?
How can you intentionally create supportive environments where peers feel empowered to express their capabilities without fear of judgment?
